--- In junit@y..., Parag Shetye <parag@s...> wrote:
> A Growing Problem
> 
[original snipped]

After reading the various replies, I don't think I could add too much 
to them...they are all good and helpful.  Just wanted to mention that 
on the current project I'm working on we just passed the 1000 test 
mark. :)  The tests take about two or three minutes to run, but 
that's because we haven't gone back to refactor some of the tests 
that are still nailing the database instead of using mocks or 
something.  Back when we were at the 400-500 mark, tests took almost 
six minutes.  I went in, found the three tests that took the most 
time, and changed them to use MockObjects...which reduced the time to 
run considerably.

I figure we'll probably hit the 2K mark before we're finished with 
the initial project, and add even more tests when we go in and do 
some major cleaning up.


-Eric
